abstract: New York State Justice Edward J McLaughlin agrees to 15-year sentencing deal with Angel Alvarez, Harlem man accused of leading a drug-selling ring, sparing him life sentence; McLaughlin says he offered deal over prosecutors' objections to avoid long and costly trial, and takes opportunity to criticize State Legislature concerning poor funding for courts.
lead_paragraph: Over prosecutors’ objections, a State Supreme Court justice in Manhattan agreed to sentence Angel Alvarez to 15 years in prison in exchange for Mr. Alvarez pleading guilty.

headline.main: Judge Spares Drug Dealer Life in Prison
headline.print_headline: Judge Spares Drug Dealer Life in Prison

snippet: Over prosecutors’ objections, a State Supreme Court justice in Manhattan agreed to sentence Angel Alvarez to 15 years in prison in exchange for Mr. Alvarez pleading guilty.
